bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: a) identical with tian she tou 天蛇頭 , celestial snake head. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao 百病主治藥：瘭疽喜著十指，狀如代指，根深至肌…俗名 天蛇毒 , “Flaming-heat impediment-illnesses tend to develop on the ten fingers. They look like ‘deputy fingers’. Their root reaches into the depth to the muscles…They are commonly called ‘ celestial snake poison ’”.

b) Of chuang 瘡 , sores, conditions developing all over the body when a person was bitten by a poisonous insect called tian she 天蛇 , ‘celestial snake’. Meng xi bi tan 夢溪筆談 25: 嘗有一田家忽 病癩，通身潰爛，號呼欲絶，西溪寺僧識之，曰：此天蛇毒耳，非癩也 , “Once there was someone named Tian who suddenly developed repudiation-illness. His entire body festered. He screamed and was at the brink of ending [his life]. A priest of the Western Creek Temple learned of this. He said: This is celestial snake poison . It is not repudiation-illness”.
